message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NA, cs.CE, cs.CV

The paper proposes a method that uses a deep convolutional neural network (CNN) as a surrogate model to reduce the computational cost of Markov Chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) for contaminant source identification. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) and Machine Learning (cs.LG) categories, as the use of neural networks is a common topic in these fields. Additionally, the paper involves numerical experiments and simulations, which suggests that it may also belong to the Numerical Analysis (cs.NA) and Computational Engineering, Finance, and Science (cs.CE) categories. Finally, the use of convolutional neural networks suggests that the paper may also belong to the Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (cs.CV) category.
